page.title: 14LIFE AT GUY HILL
page.content: Although life in this area can be very quiet the place is not really remote. Old Moor Road, although not busy, as there is an alternative, more direct route for general traffic, is kept clear during winter because it is used commonly by milk tankers. The dustbins are emptied once a week, milk is delivered daily, buses pass the top of the road regulary and there is a good selection of shops less than 3 miles away in High Bentham. The community is very friendly and Lowgill church is well attended. Both the WI and Village Society are active organisations and attract a wide range of local people. Education is no problem either as there is a good primary school in Lowgill less than 3 miles away and a good selection of secondary schools within a few miles.
